The rooms are quite big but there is hardly any lighting in there, for some reason US hotels have like 1 dim light!. The beds were really hard and i had a very sore back when i woke up. The bathroom is decent but the hot water is only average, 1 night i ended up with a very lukewarm bath. The wall are paperthin and you can hear everything that the next door neighbours are doing and saying, this kept us up quite a bit of the night we could hear everything they were saying and doing (if you get what i mean!) pretty disgusting really. The only reason we stay here is that its about 200 m from the bus stops and the train which is very handy to the city. Another good point is that they let you use the internet for about 15mins which is fantastic most places dont do this. Im not sure if i would stay again i defintely would prefer to be in the rooms by the pool not in the other area they put us in as we didnt have a problem with paperthin walls last time. Also they do have a fridge in the room which is great too. TV channels are pretty slim, it cant be full cable because in Vegas and SF we had a lot more channels than this place offered. The guys at the front desk were helpful and breakfast consisted of donuts, cereal, coffee, tea juice etc which is quite good considering its free. Overall a bit of a mixed review, its an ok place but not as good as our first visit there. The area is run down too (hollywood is not glam at all) but we never felt scared to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: carmen_bc
Reviews.Content: I found this place on Trip Advisor and based on the price and good reviews, my partner and I decided to give it a chance. We were VERY happy with our decision. The location is great (if you have a car), the rooms were in very good condition, the free parking is great and the grounds/landscaping are lovely! The free breakfast is nothing to write home about but if you like donuts I guess it's great. The price (under 100 bucks) was incredible for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel in Hollywood for the price! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Babychika211
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here during my move to Los Angeles. It was much cheaper than the Orbit hotel and hostel, which I had stayed a few nights before. This place was great, the man and the desk was very friendly, the room was nice and had a mini fridge and was CLEAN!!! Nice small continental breakfast included. On the downside, the area is a bit shady (Hollywood isn't glamorous just so you know), we saw a man walking down the street in a hospital gown and I think someone was messing with our door in the night (room doors are outside). Parking wasn't the best, but I saw people parked their Lexus there so it couldn't have been that bad! Overall the best place for the price, was not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: snippetsnoppet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hollywood City Inn for 4 nights in January 2009. LA is a bit of a minefield when it comes to selecting accommodation as all the sights are pretty well spread out, so no location is perfect. Whilst the accommodation was good, clean, tidy and serviced daily, we were disappointed with Hollywood itself which is a dump. All the trip advisor reports on LA say you need a car to get about, but we opted to make use of public transport (the underground system and buses) which we found excellent value and operated a frequent service. A day ticket is the best value. It takes about 30 mins to walk to the Hollywood sights (Hollywood&Highland Centre, Chinese Theatre) from Hollywood City Inn but quicker to get the underground which goes from just up the street from the Inn, 200 metres away. Eating out in the evenings within walking distance from the Inn was a mini-problem. There are stacks of Thai restaurants just along from the underground station - fine if you like Thai - but there wasn't much else available. We had a great steaks in the Saddle Ranch Chop House in West Hollywood. We got the bus to Santa Monica Beach (excellent breakfast at Jinky's cafe), hired bikes and rode from Santa Monica to Venice Beach, which was great fun. Also took the underground to Long Beach and to Downtown (El Pueblo worth a look, also Grand Central Market and the Walt Disney Concert Hall) The Farmers Market and The Grove great for shopping. Hollywood City Inn was a good base in a city where everything is so vast and spread out that it would be hard to pick one best location. Breakfast was included but all it comprised was an OK doughnut from a case and some filter coffee, tea or juice. Perhaps this is normal in the US though. The pool seemed just for decoration, it didn't look especially clean and I didn't see anyone using it the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: remen
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere decent to stay, within walking distance of Sunset Boulevard and the Walk of Fame at affordable prices then look no more. We stayed here for two nights, basically just using the hotel to wash and sleep. No real complaints, which is great for a place that's so cheap. We spotted some other hotels we had looked at online before booking and we're sure we made the right choice in staying here. Pros: Good location (decent neighbourhood too), Clean, Good doughnuts for breakfast, fast and free wifi. Cons: Rooms look a bit tired, staff could be a bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: turkey2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights earlier this month. If you are looking for a place to stay to sleep, shower, eat, etc. this serves that. It isn't nothing fancy but it is clean. It is close to alot of stores such as walgreens, cvs, food for less and several others. It is about a 3-5 minute drive to the attractions in Hollywood such as the walk of fame and the Kodak theater and many more. It offers free internet service in the lobby and free donuts, cereal, and coffee every morning. The guys that worked in the office were nice. There is a small area for parking. It served its purpose for me. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We chose Hollywood City Hotel as a place to crash after a long flight. It was in a location near restaurants and all-night stores. There is a Thai grocery store directly across the street. We had room 205 on the second floor in a corner. There was no street noise because the window faced the courtyard. We arrived on a cold December night, and the hot air heater warmed up the room quickly. The room was inexpensive, and we did not expect very much. The towels were small and thin, and there was no tissue in the holder, the rack holding the towels was sloping 30 degrees because a support was broken, and the towel hook on the back of the bathroom door spun around 360 degrees. The bathtub was very slippery--thank goodness for the hold bar. The bed that we used was soft, and if you sat on the edge of the bed, you would slide off onto the floor. The night clerk, Paco, was very friendly and helpful. The free wi-fi and microwave worked, and there was a freezer in the refrigerator. The complimentary breakfast was donuts, coffee, and juice. We would probably stay there again in similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in LA”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: You will not get a better room in LA for under $90 than the Hollywood City Inn. Located in a so-so section of Hollywood (Western Ave near Sunset Blvd) this "vintage" motor inn is well kept and relatively quiet. Free wifi internet, free secure parking, complimentary continental breakfast, a classic kidney shaped pool, and a simple but clean room all add up to a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here afew weeks ago with some friends for 3 nights and i had no problems.very quiet area no noise at night,location is great as others have said,5 miins from a Starbucks and the nearest metro and shops.Free internet which is always good if you want to keep in touch with friends or family back home as i did,i couldn't do this at any other location i went to for the rest of my trip,so that's a bonus.Breakfast in the reception is good but i didn't get to try it.Overall a good place to stay if you want to explore LA and you just need your room to sleep/shower in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: KEMerk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find for people not familiar with LA. The staff were friendly and helpful. A reasonable continental breakfast is provided and fast WiFi is also available for free. Rooms are a little old but comfortable and represent very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a worn out look”
Reviews.Author: DrRobert78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood inn for 3 days and had only good experiences. The hotel has an old and worn down look to it. But when you see through that it is very clean and has a perfect location. Just 1 block from the metro and next to holywood boulevard. The neighbourhood has had it's best time but we had no problems with that. For breakfast...go to the Starbucks at Hollywood blvd. Parking is free. Good price/quality relation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved out stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilL81
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay, will book the hotel again if I go there the second time. Hollywood City Inn has a very nice swimming pool and is fantastic for having breakfast next to it. Location wise, very convenient, only 1 block away from Hollywood Western station. There is a Ralphs (supermarket) and Ross (clothing store, lots of cheap bargins, I bought 3 dresses & 2 jumpers) just opposite the station. Hotel room is very clean, there's airconditioning, TV, fridge & hair dryer in the room. Free wireless internet in the room as well as lobby, speed was good. The best part is the free breakfast, we loved our donuts, juice & cereal. There's coffee as well. We visited Universal Studio, only 3 stations away, very close. Remember to use the left exit of the station for shuttle bus (you need to cross the road as well), we went out the wrong exit, took us a while to find the shuttle to universal studio. We had 2 day pass for the price of 1 deal, only got 2 rides, but all the shows are fantastic, you'll need 2 days to finish all the shows if you don't wanna rush it. No need to buy the all you can eat pass, as the meal size is pretty big. We had burger for the first day & chinese for the second day's lunch. Hollywood itself was not very impressive, not much to do, recommend to book a movie star tour with starline, the old tour guide was very funny. Hotel staff was very helpful when we check-in, we got a map & direction. The guy on the night shift was very helpful too and booked shuttle bus for us when we left. We got ripped off by the taxi driver from airport to the hotel, cost us $79, if you book shuttle bus, will only cost $16 per person. Security wise, we didn't go out after 7pm since we don't have a car. Hotel security is pretty good, 2 locks on the door, bars on windows, very bright outdoor light, we feel quite safe staying there. In the station, there are some suspicious people hanging around, but we only catch train during the day, and to popular areas (hollywood highland & universal city), so didn't have any problems. During peak hours, there are plenty of people on the train, no safety issue really. Overall we had a very good stay, this hotel is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sheppy10
Reviews.Content: If you want a pleasant and friendly conversations with staff - this is not the place... If you want a clean , central location , with immediate access to subway - several shops etc ...this is the place. We stayed here with our 2 daughters (5 and 7) and had no concerns or encountered issues with other reports about the area (homeless folk etc) We walked around at night with no issues. If you leave them alone they will leave you alone....... Sub-Way just a few hundred metres away taking you to Universal Studios (3 stops) Walk of fame (2 stops) , and at $5 for a day pass is considerably cheaper than paying a company to take you. Room had fridge / Air Condition , but no Kettle etc. As this room was only a place to sleep we were more than happy with our accomodation. We didnt find the owners friendly and it appeared our questions were a chore to them (Even at check-in) As we were there 4 days we only encountered them a few times so this didnt cause much aggro. For the price Yes stay there , and use money you save on yourself in LA. Our savings went towards "front of the Queue pass" at universal (something I recommend...but thats another story) Pool was clean and spent some hours in it. Recommend the diner (turn left at subway , 100 yards) for your breakfasts. Caters for the locals and not ramped up prices. For Dinner at Sizzlers just another 300 yards further down the road in Thai town. 25 walk (uphill) to griffiths observatory. Downsides : On check out I asked to leave my bags in storage and women wanted to charge me $20 for 3 bags. After questioning this it immediately dropped to $15. Not sure why the charges as the bags dont eat anything. Thats anyother minor issue if you like inhouse breakfasts - This is only only donuts , and Coffee if you could ever find the pot with coffee in it. Although only 2 floors, there is no lift should you have heavy bags and be on the second floor. Softdrink machine available - dont ask for change unless you wish for a grunt in reply.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location of hollywood city inn”
Reviews.Author: clonmelMelbourne
Reviews.Content: great location,very helpful staff,rooms clean,tv microwave ect.we stayed at this hotel twice on our trip to usa,subway nearby,and good selection of reastarunts,would reccomend highly.oliver and sue,melbourne australia.

Reviews.Title: “Super welcome”
Reviews.Author: MB9191
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel, 1.6 miles from Walk of Fame at reasonnable rate. Superstores at 300 m. The receptionist is very kind and ready to help you (he knows everything). There is a nice swimming pool where you can have your breakfast. Free parking A place I will go again if I come back to LA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: mylbou
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about Hollywood City Inn before arriving to my room. We had a large and clean room, bathroom apears to be brand new, comfy bed, lunch area, microwave, frig, tv, wi-fi, and pool. All that you need to have a great stay in hollywood! Subway station on the corner of the street. Surrondings may not seems hi-class but are safe. Overall - perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right, the neighorhood sketchy”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to LA last week. She went on line and found us this "deal". I read the reviews and most of them were positive. We were leaving from central Calif and so I made sure we arrived before dark. The overall experience was pleasant. The staff were very nice. We had asked to stay close to the office since we were 2 women traveling alone. When we got there we were given a room in their 2nd newer building which is a little further from the office. They immediately change our room upon our request. The breakfast was cereal, coffee and pastries. The Metro is only 1 block north. That would probably be a great way to travel as long as you arrived back before dark-I wouldn't want to walk even that 1 block after dark. We went to see "Wicked" and arrived back at 11:30. We managed to squeeze into the last parking spot. A car arrived just after we did. I would not want to park on the street after dark for my car and my own safety. Perhaps they have some way of parking your car off site for you if this happens-it doesn't seem there are enough parking spaces if they are booked to capacity. The best things about this motel are the price, cleanliness, staff, beautiful roses around the pool and accessabilty of areas of interest and easy highway access. Early morning walks: both days I grabbed a Starbucks cappucino and went for a walk. I went south toward Sunset Blvd. I went about 0.5 miles. The further I went, the seedier it got with homeless and tagging etc. However, I went North on Western Ave and found the beautiful neighborhood of Los Feliz and enjoyed looking at the homes and gardens. As I further ventured north I found Griffith Park and walked in there. It was beautiful. It was hard to believe that in less than a mile you go from a seedy run down area to a beautiful neighborhood and park setting. So all in all, for the price, I probably would stay there again. It felt safe enough during the day to walk north and into the area called Thai Town. Again walking south down Western Ave and onto Sunset Blvd is a little sketchy and there really isn't anything to see that way.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: biting
Reviews.Content: Ok place to stay. Paid about US$70+ per night. Bedsheets were clean. Towels were clean. Looks like a family business to me. The guy who manages the place was quite friendly. The lady, probably his wife, wasn't very friendly. She even tried to make me pay for WIFI which was listed as free in their website. Eventually I talked to the guy and he gave me the user id and password free. Comes with air con and heater. Ample parking. Comes with breakfast, but the breakfast was nothing much. Just some juices, coffee and donuts. But it was sufficient for me for the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Price”
Reviews.Author: timgrooters
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit the Hollywood area, this is the one. I is the most inexpensive of all of the "chain" motels. The room was large and very modern and clean. it is 1/2 block from Hollywood Blvd and then just a few block to the main part of Hollywood. If you go west on Hollywood to Gower and then to the North, you can get some nice photos of the sign. There are lots of places to stop just a couple of blocks from the Inn (Walgreens, etc) if you need any incidentals. It is located in the old part of Hollywood but the area is clean. Remember, the touristy part of Hollywood is also very old. Have already booked a couple of rooms here for August when we are taking our daughters for some site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: shawnie
Reviews.Content: You know what?? This place may not be a 5 star, 4 star or even a 3 star motel but it serves its purpose!! Its a good place to drop your bags and lay your head. Ya, the furniture may not be the best and is a little outdated but for the price you pay to stay here (I got a good deal anyway) it works!! Its central location right off Hollywood Blvd is close to alot if not most attractions. 5 mins to Burbank, 5-10 mins to Universal Studios (depending on traffic) and the Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Blvd is only 5 mins as well. As for cleaniness, I found it to be good!! Room was very clean. Hallways were well kept. The pool area was nice and the staff at the front desk were very helpful. If your someone who feels the need for the little extras or expects to be pampered this is not the place for you. It works basically as a good base while exploring the LA. As for the location. Many have said the area is shady and unsafe but I found it to be perfectly fine!! No worries or problems when out during the day or at night...I'll definitely consider this place when in LA again

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: monkeySanMateo
Reviews.Content: Date: September 25-27 2007 Cockroach Motel I will make this short and to the pointâ€¦we only stayed here for one night out of our 2-night reservation. The first night seemed to be OK, even though the condition of the room was less than to be desired. The furniture was in very bad condition, run down and falling apartâ€¦cheapest bathroom towels Iâ€™ve ever had to useâ€¦too small and too thin. Rug was dirty and stained. This hotel is on the east side of Hollywoodâ€¦what does that tell ya?! The second night we came homeâ€¦only to find a GIANT cockroach on the bathroom floor, and another in the room next door that we also paid for! This place needs to be fumigatedâ€¦these are unsatisfactory conditions, and this place should not be recommended by any of the on-line travel services!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as Reviewed”
Reviews.Author: DaveG130
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights as part of our American/Honeymoon tour after getting married in Vegas. We read the reviews and decided to give it a go anyway. Yes the hotel is like a travelodge , but its a good price. Yes it is quite a way from most of the main area And Yes we were warned by our shuttle driver not to walk around here at night , which really made us feel like we'd made a mistake. But , it was ideal place to stay for us . The underground subway is 1 block away ,the bus route is on the same corner and with a full day pass for both at $5 a great base . We saw no hassle , gangs , druggies ,prostitutes or any reason to be afraid . Used the buses to get everywhere or the Underground to get directly to Universal City. The room was cleaned every day , clean towels and sheets, the room (205) was quiet ,secure, 65 tv channels , microwave and fridge , what else could you need. On the whole a budget room with excellent access to attractions with a quiet clean room . Would stay here if ever to visit L.A. again.

Reviews.Title: “good base camp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel my party and i were unsure if we had made the right decision, but as we only needed it for five days as a base camp we went ahead with it. The room was of a good size and was welcoming and clean which is the most important thing i look for in a hotel room. I disagre with some of the other comments made by previous guests. The room was cleaned throughly every day and we had new toiletries and towels everyday, when we asked for extra pillows they were more than happy to give us some. The staff were very friendly and one man in particular on reception was very helpful, when it came to needing local information. When we were there they even had new beds put in! so they are not hard anymore although i preferred the old ones! As a building it is a little dated and could do with a few repairs and its not in the nicest part of town but after a couple of days you get to know the area and start to feel more comfortable, still wouldn't walk around late at night but then i wouldn't do that in England either! Being a motel style if there is noise at night you will hear it as the walls are quite thin if you are a light sleeper but i found the noise of the other guests didn't go on that long when it was made i guess it depends on whose staying. Overall if you just need a basic place to stay then this would suit, if your used to luxury then i would look somewhere else! The hotel itself has obviously read previous reviews and has acted upon them to make this place better so hats off to them!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel of Horrors”
Reviews.Author: Disneylandfan90
Reviews.Content: Well to start i really liked the service that I got from the Hotels staff, my review though is on the hotel my family and I stayed at which was Hollywood city inn in Hollywood, California the staff at the hotel were rude and a few of the other guest were aloud to drink outside of their rooms with their room doors wide open which had music blasting out of them past 10 o' clock, clothes and comforters were hung from bannisters, and it was located in a area that didnt look so trusting or pleasant, i would not reccommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our group arrived at two different times, so our roommates were there a few hours earlier than my sister and I. So by the time we got there it was one in the morning. We called our roommates, but they had had a long day and did not wake up when we called, so my sister went to the front desk and asked the attendant for a key (we had proper documents and they were notified that we were coming) and he wouldn't give her a key because he said that he only has one key for every room. So, we just had to fend for ourselves. So by that time I had taken all of our luggage out and was waiting by the door to get in, but when my sister came out, she said he wouldn't give us a key so we just waited by the car and the door trying to wait for someone to come out of the doors to let us in. So we were just standing out there (two girls) in this part of town which looked dangerous with suspicious people walking around looking at us ( I wouldn't recommend walking in this area at night). We tried pulling on one of the doors of the entrance to the rooms, but it was locked. Then my sister went to the other entrance door and luckily it was opened and she went in and opened the other door where I was standing and we were able to get into the hallway were the rooms were located. So, we knocked on the door and our roommates were able to hear us and let us in, but they were half sleep. We were doing things the whole day and we were all extremely tired, so my sister and I went to sleep around 2am and were extremely tired. But by 3:30am, we heard a knock at our door. At first I thought it was next door or I had imagined it because we were all "knocked out" sleep. But the knocking kept occurring and I rose up and one of the other girls with us got out of bed and opened the door and immediately closed and locked it because she thought it was either me or my sister, but quickly realized that we were already there. Then this man started whispering "let me in", "open the door", and started making rhythmical knocks at the door. So my roommate yelled at him from behind the door to leave and he has the wrong room. Then it stopped and we all went back to sleep nervously. Then about 10 mins later, the knocking came back and he tried to open the door because I saw the door knob being turned and we all were very scared by now, so we called the front desk and the told the attendant what was happening and he said that he will take care of it. So we laid down again but the strange man kept talking and knocking at the door trying to open it for about 5+ minutes. We were so scared we didn't know what to do, but keep telling him to go away. But we were so tired we could think clearly like call the police. We weren't going to open the door and confront him so he could come inside our room, we didn't know if he was alone or not and it was just us girls; so we called the front desk again and my sister said "please help us, the man is still at the door and is trying to come in!" The attendant sounded annoyed and told her "weren't you expecting him" and of course she yelled "of course not!! Why would we call you to help us, if we knew him!", so the attendant said "okay, I will take care of him, but don't call back. " We were very annoyed by this and then my other roommate went to the door and said, "if you don't leave, we will call the police!" Then he stopped whispering and said "Oh, sorry I thought this was Mike" or something of that nature, but I am sure he had heard us clearly the first couple of times and then he left. But we were so scared, we didn't open the door to look if he was gone. That morning, we were still frighten to open the door to leave. Luckily, we were only staying there one night and we will never stay there again!! They have no concern for the safety of their customers and the room and location isn't that great either. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel but when we can choose again we will spend some extra dollars somewhere else. The people look tired of helping their customers. When we received the keys of our room we needed to return them directly because there was water coming in the room from the roof. The second room looked better but the door was difficult to lock. With some force we made it. We payed $52,04 dollar for one night but you'd better check other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “continental breakfast??????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel are not made for children,,itÂ´s only coffee to drink for breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok so the pictures on the website show this cute quaint little hotel with nice soft beds and flowing curtains. That is the BIGGEST MISRESPRESENTATION IMAGINABLE. The hotel is generally clean (which is why I was able to deal with it for three nights). However, it doesn't have enough parking, the beds are slightly better than sleeping on the floor, and I think that the last time the place was updated was in the 80's. They didn't even have extra pillows. If you are looking for a super cheap place near Hollywood to crash for a night this is the place. If you are looking for something like what is shown in the photos don't go here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood City Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1615 N. Western Ave., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027-4807
